info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:43PM CDT until August 06 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR TALLADEGA...SOUTHWESTERN CALHOUN...EAST CENTRAL ST. CLAIR AND NORTHEASTERN COOSA COUNTIES... At 342 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ragland to near Munford to near Stewartville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Talladega, Sylacauga, Goodwater, Weogufka, Stewartville, Lincoln, Riverside, Ragland, Munford, Ohatchee, Oak Grove, Waldo, Hanover, Bradford, Winterboro, Talladega Superspeedway, Hatchet, Talladega Municipal Airport, Grant Town and Alpine. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
